00038 void
00039 VSPrintF( tstring& out, const char* fmt, va_list marker )
00040 {
00041 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00042 
00046         int bufSize = _vscprintf( fmt, marker );
00047         char *buf = ( char * )alloca( bufSize + 1 );
00048         vsprintf_s( buf, bufSize+1, fmt, marker );
00049 
00051         out = buf;
00052 #else
00053         for ( int size = 128; ; size *= 2 ) 
00054         {
00055                 char *buf = new char[ size + 1 ];
00056                 va_list temp_marker;
00057                 va_copy( temp_marker, marker );
00058                 int ret = vsnprintf( buf, size, fmt, temp_marker );
00059                 va_end( temp_marker );
00060                 if ( ret < 0 ) 
00061                 {
00064                         delete[] buf;
00065                 }
00066                 else if ( ret >= size )
00067                 {
00070                         delete[] buf;
00071                         char *buf = new char[ ret + 2 ];
00072                         va_copy( temp_marker, marker );
00073                         vsnprintf( buf, ret + 1, fmt, temp_marker );
00074                         va_end( temp_marker );
00075                         out = buf;
00076                         delete[] buf;
00077                         return;
00078                 } else 
00079                 {
00081                         out = buf;
00082                         delete[] buf;
00083                         return;
00084                 }
00085         }
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 }

00091 //----------------------------------------------------------
00092 void
00093 SPrintF( tstring& out, const char *fmt, ... )
00094 {
00095         va_list marker;
00096         va_start( marker, fmt );
00097         VSPrintF( out, fmt, marker );
00098         va_end( marker );
00099 }

00101 //----------------------------------------------------------
00102 size_t
00103 StrLenUTF8( const char* str )
00104 {
00105         int len = ::MultiByteToWideChar( CP_UTF8, 0, str, -1, 0, 0 )-1;
00106         return size_t( len < 0 ? 0 : len );
00107 }
00108 
00109 //----------------------------------------------------------
00110 const char*
00111 NextCharUTF8( const char* str )
00112 {
00113         B_ASSERT( str != 0 );
00114 
00116         if ( *str == 0 )
00117                 return 0;
00118 
00120         const char* next = 0;
00121         if ( ((*str)&0xF0) == 0xF0 )
00122                 next = str+4;
00123         else if ( ((*str)&0xE0) == 0xE0 )
00124                 next = str+3;
00125         else if ( ((*str)&0xC0) == 0xC0 )
00126                 next = str+2;
00127         else if ( ((*str)&0x80) == 0x80 )
00128                 next = str+1;
00129 
00131         return *next == 0 ? 0 : next;
00132 }
00133 
00134 //----------------------------------------------------------
00135 unsigned int
00136 GetCharLenUTF8( const char* chr )
00137 {
00138         B_ASSERT( chr != 0 );
00139 
00141         if ( *chr == 0 )
00142                 return 0;
00143 
00145         const char* next = 0;
00146         if ( ((*chr)&0xF0) == 0xF0 )
00147                 return 4;
00148         else if ( ((*chr)&0xE0) == 0xE0 )
00149                 return 3;
00150         else if ( ((*chr)&0xC0) == 0xC0 )
00151                 return 2;
00152 
00155         return 1;
00156 }

00158 //----------------------------------------------------------
00159 unsigned int
00160 HashMem32( const void* mem, unsigned int size, unsigned int hashStart )
00161 {
00163         const char* str = ( const char* )mem;
00164         const int kPrime = 16777619;
00165         for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < size; ++i )
00166         {
00168                 int ch = str[ i ] & 0xFF;
00169                 hashStart = ( hashStart * kPrime );
00170                 hashStart = hashStart ^ ch;
00171         }
00172 
00174         return hashStart;
00175 }
00176 
00177 //----------------------------------------------------------
00178 unsigned __int64
00179 HashMem64( const void* mem, unsigned int size, unsigned __int64 hashStart )
00180 {
00182         const char* str = ( const char* )mem;
00183         const __int64 kPrime = 1099511628211LL;
00184         for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < size; ++i )
00185         {
00187                 __int64 ch = str[ i ] & 0xFF;
00188                 hashStart = ( hashStart * kPrime );
00189                 hashStart = hashStart ^ ch;
00190         }
00191 
00193         return hashStart;
00194 }

00223 #else
00225         //char *buf = ( char * )alloca( 1 );

00295 //----------------------------------------------------------
00296 void*
00297 AlignedAlloc( unsigned int alignmentPow2, unsigned int size )
00298 {
00299         B_ASSERT( IsPow2( alignmentPow2 ) && alignmentPow2 >= sizeof( char* ) );
00300 
00301 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00302         return _aligned_malloc( size, alignmentPow2 );
00303 #else
00305         unsigned int mask = alignmentPow2 - 1;
00306         char* mem = new char[ size + mask + alignmentPow2 ];
00307 
00309         char* aligned = mem + mask + alignmentPow2;
00310         aligned = ( char* )( ( size_t )aligned & ~mask );
00311 
00313         char* origPtr = aligned;
00314         origPtr -= sizeof( char* );
00315         *( ( char** )origPtr ) = mem;
00316 
00318         return aligned;
00319 #endif
00320 }
00321 
00322 //----------------------------------------------------------
00323 void
00324 AlignedFree( void* alignedMemory )
00325 {
00326 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00327         _aligned_free( alignedMemory );
00328 #else
00330         char* mem = ( char* )alignedMemory;
00331         mem -= sizeof( char* );
00332         mem = *( ( char** )mem );
00333 
00335         delete[] mem;
00336 #endif
00337 }

00343 //----------------------------------------------------------
00344 void* TempAlloc( unsigned int size )
00345 {
00348         if ( size <= TEMP_MEM_SIZE && LockSwap( &_tempMemGate, 1 ) == 0 )
00349                 return _tempMem;
00350         else
00351                 return AlignedAlloc( 16, size );
00352 }
00353 
00354 //----------------------------------------------------------
00355 void TempFree( void* mem )
00356 {
00357         if ( mem == _tempMem )
00358                 LockSwap( &_tempMemGate, 0 );
00359         else
00360                 AlignedFree( mem );
00361 }

00370 #define TINY_BLOCK_COPY 64
00371 
00376 #define IN_CACHE_COPY 64 * 1024
00377 
00384 #define UNCACHED_COPY 197 * 1024
00385 
00387 #define BLOCK_PREFETCH_COPY infinity
00388 
00395 #define CACHEBLOCK 80h
00396 
00397 //----------------------------------------------------------
00398 void MemCopy( void* dest, const void* src, unsigned int n )
00399 {
00400 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00401         __asm {
00402                 mov             ecx, [n]                        ; number of bytes to copy
00403                 mov             edi, [dest]                     ; destination
00404                 mov             esi, [src]                      ; source
00405                 mov             ebx, ecx                        ; keep a copy of count
00406 
00407                 cld
00408                 cmp             ecx, TINY_BLOCK_COPY
00409                 jb              $memcpy_ic_3            ; tiny? skip mmx copy
00410 
00411                 cmp             ecx, 32*1024            ; don't align between 32k-64k because
00412                 jbe             $memcpy_do_align        ; it appears to be slower
00413                 cmp             ecx, 64*1024
00414                 jbe             $memcpy_align_done
00415 
00416         $memcpy_do_align:
00417                 mov             ecx, 8                          ; a trick that's faster than rep movsb...
00418                 sub             ecx, edi                        ; align destination to qword
00419                 and             ecx, 111b                       ; get the low bits
00420                 sub             ebx, ecx                        ; update copy count
00421                 neg             ecx                                     ; set up to jump into the array
00422                 add             ecx, offset $memcpy_align_done
00423                 jmp             ecx                                     ; jump to array of movsb's
00424 
00425         align 4
00426                 movsb
00427                 movsb
00428                 movsb
00429                 movsb
00430                 movsb
00431                 movsb
00432                 movsb
00433                 movsb
00434         
00435         $memcpy_align_done:                             ; destination is dword aligned
00436                 mov             ecx, ebx                        ; number of bytes left to copy
00437                 shr             ecx, 6                          ; get 64-byte block count
00438                 jz              $memcpy_ic_2            ; finish the last few bytes
00439 
00440                 cmp             ecx, IN_CACHE_COPY/64   ; too big 4 cache? use uncached copy
00441                 jae             $memcpy_uc_test
00442 
00446         align 16
00447         $memcpy_ic_1:                                   ; 64-byte block copies, in-cache copy
00448 
00449                 prefetchnta [esi + (200*64/34+192)]             ; start reading ahead
00450                 movq    mm0, [esi+0]            ; read 64 bits
00451                 movq    mm1, [esi+8]
00452                 movq    [edi+0], mm0            ; write 64 bits
00453                 movq    [edi+8], mm1            ;       note: the normal movq writes the
00454                 movq    mm2, [esi+16]           ;       data to cache; a cache line will be
00455                 movq    mm3, [esi+24]           ;       allocated as needed, to store the data
00456                 movq    [edi+16], mm2
00457                 movq    [edi+24], mm3
00458                 movq    mm0, [esi+32]
00459                 movq    mm1, [esi+40]
00460                 movq    [edi+32], mm0
00461                 movq    [edi+40], mm1
00462                 movq    mm2, [esi+48]
00463                 movq    mm3, [esi+56]
00464                 movq    [edi+48], mm2
00465                 movq    [edi+56], mm3
00466 
00467                 add             esi, 64                         ; update source pointer
00468                 add             edi, 64                         ; update destination pointer
00469                 dec             ecx ; count down
00470                 jnz             $memcpy_ic_1            ; last 64-byte block?
00471 
00472         $memcpy_ic_2:
00473                 mov             ecx, ebx                        ; has valid low 6 bits of the byte count
00474         $memcpy_ic_3:
00475                 shr             ecx, 2                          ; dword count
00476                 and             ecx, 1111b                      ; only look at the "remainder" bits
00477                 neg             ecx                                     ; set up to jump into the array
00478                 add             ecx, offset $memcpy_last_few
00479                 jmp             ecx                                     ; jump to array of movsd's
00480 
00481         $memcpy_uc_test:
00482                 cmp             ecx, UNCACHED_COPY/64   ; big enough? use block prefetch copy
00483                 jae             $memcpy_bp_1
00484 
00485         $memcpy_64_test:
00486                 or              ecx, ecx                        ; tail end of block prefetch will jump here
00487                 jz              $memcpy_ic_2            ; no more 64-byte blocks left
00488 
00493         align 16
00494         $memcpy_uc_1:                                   ; 64-byte blocks, uncached copy
00495                 prefetchnta [esi + (200*64/34+192)] ; start reading ahead
00496                 movq    mm0,[esi+0]                     ; read 64 bits
00497                 add             edi,64                          ; update destination pointer
00498                 movq    mm1,[esi+8]
00499                 add             esi,64                          ; update source pointer
00500                 movq    mm2,[esi-48]
00501                 movntq  [edi-64], mm0           ; write 64 bits, bypassing the cache
00502                 movq    mm0,[esi-40]            ; note: movntq also prevents the CPU
00503                 movntq  [edi-56], mm1           ; from READING the destination address
00504                 movq    mm1,[esi-32]            ; into the cache, only to be over-written
00505                 movntq  [edi-48], mm2           ; so that also helps performance
00506                 movq    mm2,[esi-24]
00507                 movntq  [edi-40], mm0
00508                 movq    mm0,[esi-16]
00509                 movntq  [edi-32], mm1
00510                 movq    mm1,[esi-8]
00511                 movntq  [edi-24], mm2
00512                 movntq  [edi-16], mm0
00513                 dec ecx
00514                 movntq [edi-8], mm1
00515                 jnz $memcpy_uc_1                        ; last 64-byte block?
00516 
00517                 jmp $memcpy_ic_2                        ; almost done
00518 
00524         $memcpy_bp_1:                                   ; large blocks, block prefetch copy
00525                 cmp             ecx, CACHEBLOCK         ; big enough to run another prefetch loop?
00526                 jl              $memcpy_64_test         ; no, back to regular uncached copy
00527                 mov             eax, CACHEBLOCK / 2             ; block prefetch loop, unrolled 2X
00528                 add             esi, CACHEBLOCK * 64    ; move to the top of the block
00529         align 16
00530         $memcpy_bp_2:
00531                 mov             edx, [esi-64]           ; grab one address per cache line
00532                 mov             edx, [esi-128]          ; grab one address per cache line
00533                 sub             esi, 128                        ; go reverse order
00534                 dec             eax                                     ; count down the cache lines
00535                 jnz             $memcpy_bp_2            ; keep grabbing more lines into cache
00536 
00537                 mov eax, CACHEBLOCK                     ; now that it's in cache, do the copy
00538         align 16
00539         $memcpy_bp_3:
00540                 movq    mm0, [esi ]                     ; read 64 bits
00541                 movq    mm1, [esi+ 8]
00542                 movq    mm2, [esi+16]
00543                 movq    mm3, [esi+24]
00544                 movq    mm4, [esi+32]
00545                 movq    mm5, [esi+40]
00546                 movq    mm6, [esi+48]
00547                 movq    mm7, [esi+56]
00548                 add             esi, 64                         ; update source pointer
00549                 movntq [edi ], mm0                      ; write 64 bits, bypassing cache
00550                 movntq [edi+ 8], mm1            ; note: movntq also prevents the CPU
00551                 movntq [edi+16], mm2            ; from READING the destination address
00552                 movntq [edi+24], mm3            ; into the cache, only to be over-written,
00553                 movntq [edi+32], mm4            ; so that also helps performance
00554                 movntq [edi+40], mm5
00555                 movntq [edi+48], mm6
00556                 movntq [edi+56], mm7
00557                 add edi, 64                                     ; update dest pointer
00558 
00559                 dec eax                                         ; count down
00560 
00561                 jnz $memcpy_bp_3                        ; keep copying
00562                 sub ecx, CACHEBLOCK                     ; update the 64-byte block count
00563                 jmp $memcpy_bp_1                        ; keep processing blocks
00564 
00567         align 4
00568                 movsd
00569                 movsd ; perform last 1-15 dword copies
00570                 movsd
00571                 movsd
00572                 movsd
00573                 movsd
00574                 movsd
00575                 movsd
00576                 movsd
00577                 movsd ; perform last 1-7 dword copies
00578                 movsd
00579                 movsd
00580                 movsd
00581                 movsd
00582                 movsd
00583                 movsd
00584 
00585         $memcpy_last_few:                               ; dword aligned from before movsd's
00586                 mov             ecx, ebx                        ; has valid low 2 bits of the byte count
00587                 and             ecx, 11b                        ; the last few cows must come home
00588                 jz              $memcpy_final           ; no more, let's leave
00589                 rep             movsb                           ; the last 1, 2, or 3 bytes
00590 
00591         $memcpy_final:
00592                 emms ; clean up the MMX state
00593                 sfence ; flush the write buffer
00594                 mov eax, [dest] ; ret value = destination pointer
00595         }
00596 #else
00597         return memcpy( dest, src, n );
00598 #endif
00599 }

00601 //----------------------------------------------------------
00602 void 
00603 StrTokenize( TokenContainer& tokens, const char* str )
00604 {
00605         size_t len = strlen( str );
00606 
00608         char* localCopy = new char[ len+1 ];
00609         MemCopy( localCopy, str, (unsigned int)len+1 );
00610 
00612         char* context = 0;
00613         char* token = strtok_s( localCopy, "\n\r\t ", &context );
00614         while( token )
00615         {
00616                 tokens.push_back( token );
00617                 token = strtok_s( 0, "\n\r\t ", &context );
00618         }
00619 
00621         delete [] localCopy;
00622 }

00624 //----------------------------------------------------------
00625 tstring&
00626 StrToLower( tstring& str )
00627 {
00628         size_t strLen = str.length();
00629         for ( size_t i = 0; i < strLen; ++i )
00630                 str[ i ] = _tolower( str[ i ] );
00631         return str;
00632 }
